message.content:
<<<api>>>: TypedArray.getString
<<<code>>>: 
TypedArray array = getResources().obtainTypedArray(R.array.countries_array);
ArrayList<String[]> list = new ArrayList<>();
for (int i = 0; i < array.length(); i++) {
    int id = array.getResourceId(i, 0);
    if (id > 0) {
        String[] country = getResources().getStringArray(id);
        list.add(country);
    }
}
array.recycle();
<<<explanation>>>: The code above retrieves the 2D array from the XML string resource. It first obtains the TypedArray of the resource array. Then it iterates through the TypedArray, getting the resource ID of each item. If the ID is valid, it retrieves the string array of the item and adds it to the ArrayList. Finally, it recycles the TypedArray to free up memory.
